title: GitHub Actions, Issues and Pages to build a daily planner
description: Simon Willison demonstrates how to create an automated daily planner using GitHub's features. Uses a private repository with GitHub Issues as the planning interface, GitHub Actions to maintain an index, and GitHub Pages to serve a redirector page.
notes: Clever use of GitHub Issues + Actions + Pages for personal planning

title: Effective Harnesses for Long-Running Agents
description: Anthropic presents solutions for enabling AI agents to make consistent progress across multiple context windows by using specialized initializer and coding agents that maintain structured environment state.
notes: Claude Agent SDK patterns for long-running tasks

title: Building and deploying with GitHub Actions and Pages
description: A minimal pattern for creating and publishing custom websites using GitHub Actions workflows and GitHub Pages hosting, with step-by-step configuration instructions and practical examples.

title: Making Wrong Code Look Wrong
description: Joel Spolsky explores how coding conventions can make errors visually apparent, using security examples with unsafe versus safe strings to demonstrate how architectural choices help programmers catch bugs through pattern recognition.
notes: Classic article on Apps Hungarian and making bugs obvious
